Package a11rallypong

A package that contains the classes for a Pong Game.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ball
    The ball class creates a ball that moves around on the screen and is hit back and forth between two paddles.
    base
    The base class is an abstract class that holds the essential methods and values to be inherited by the ball and paddle classes.
    DrawHere
    The DrawHere class takes care of initializing and running all of the threads in the app.
    FileRW
    The FileRW class is responsible for reading and writing data to files.
    GameFrame
    The GameFrame class is responsible for creating a Frame for the pong game to be rendered in.
    GameOverGUI
    The GameOverGUI class creates a GUI for the user to submit their score to the save file of scores or quit the game without saving it.
    HighScoresGUI
    The HighScoresGUI class creates a GUI that displays the top ten high scores achieved in the game.
    MainMenuGUI
    The MainMenuGUI class creates a GUI that the user can decide what to do in the game.
    paddle
    The paddle class extends the base class to make a rectangle on the screen used to hit the ball back and forth.
    score
    The score class is an object that holds three items.
    ScoreArray
    The ScoreArray class is an object that holds an ArrayList of score objects to be saved to a file and read later in the HighScoresGUI.

Package a11rallypong Description

A package that contains the classes for a Pong Game. The a11rallypong package contains eleven java classes. A base class has two derived classes called ball and paddle. These classes are employed on a JFrame to represent two paddles rallying a ball back and forth. There are multiple GUIs for this application; a Main Menu, High Scores window and a Game Over window which were all built via window builder. The package also has a class that reads from and writes to a file the highscores achieved by players.
Author:
Erich
